usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: The script explicitly uses `_kModelSpace` during `TslInst.dbCreate`. It creates `Sheet` entities directly in the model. It lacks `sd_` prefixes, `#Type E` declarations, `_Viewport` checks, or `Sheet` generation typical of fabrication drawing scripts.

prerequisites.requiredSpace: The script requires a valid Element and Opening within the model to calculate packer geometry.

opmProperties.description: |Defines the position of the boards. Packers are inside the opening, Covering boards cover the opening from the outside|
|Defines the width of the board. Using one value set all widths. Using a semicolon separated sequence sets the width for: top; bottom; right; left independent|
|Defines the thickness of the board. Using one value set all thicknesses. Using a semicolon separated sequence sets the thickness for: top; bottom; right; left independent|
|Defines the Gap at the end of the sheet. Using one value, the gap is on all ends. Use a semicolon separated sequence to define an individual gap. eg: top; bottom; right; left|
|Defines the Gap to the opening Using one value, the gap is on all sides. Use a semicolon separated sequence to define an individual gap. eg: top; bottom; right; left|

|Set sheet property. The properties are separated by a semicolon. Empty properties need a blank. Sequence:| ColourIndex; Name; Material; Grade; Information; Label; SubLabel; Beamcode. E.g: 2;Packer;OSB; ;on site|
|Defines the zone where the sheets are asigned to|
|Defines the zone the sheet is aligned to. Negative zones are aligned to outside zone, positive are algined to inside zone. ThatÂ´s what zone 6 is good for|
|Defines the offset to the zone. The sheet is algined to in wall Z direction (towards outside is positive)|
|Defines the reference for the position of the packers. Construction uses the closest beams to the opening. Otherwise the outside of the opening is used.|
|Defines for Reference = Construction, if parallel beams should be considered.|
|Defines if the Tsl stays in the drawing, or is deleted afterwards|

scriptPurpose.summary: Automatically generates timber sheeting (packers/reveal liners or covering boards) around wall openings based on defined wall layers and zones.
scriptPurpose.typicalUseCase: Adding structural backing for drywall around windows ( Packers) or adding aesthetic external timber returns around doors (Covering boards).

parameters.name: sFunction
parameters.businessMeaning: Defines the geometric logic of the board. 'Packer' creates boards inside the opening reveal, while 'Covering board' creates boards overlapping the opening face.
parameters.affectsOutput: Determines whether the sheet is placed inside the structural frame or covering the aperture face.

parameters.name: sWidth
parameters.businessMeaning: The width of the board (dimension across the wall face). Supports individual values per side (Top; Bottom; Right; Left).
parameters.affectsOutput: Controls the horizontal depth of the board geometry. For Packers, this is the depth into the reveal.

parameters.name: sHeight
parameters.businessMeaning: The thickness of the board material. Supports individual values per side.
parameters.affectsOutput: Controls the thickness (Z-height) of the generated Sheet entity.

parameters.name: sGapEnd
parameters.businessMeaning: Clearance margin at the ends of the sheet (where it meets studs/trimmers). Allows for shrinkage or tolerances.
parameters.affectsOutput: Shortens the length of the board relative to the surrounding construction.

parameters.name: sGapOp
parameters.businessMeaning: Clearance margin relative to the Opening aperture (window/door frame).
parameters.affectsOutput: Offsets the board start/end points away from the opening edges.

parameters.name: sProps
parameters.businessMeaning: Defines material properties, naming, and layering for production reports (BOM) and drawing styles.
parameters.affectsOutput: Sets entity attributes (Name, Material, Grade, etc.) on the resulting Sheet.

parameters.name: nAsignZone
parameters.businessMeaning: Assigns the generated board to a specific structural layer (Zone) within the wall element for logical grouping and nesting.
parameters.affectsOutput: Sets the logical Zone property of the Sheet entity.

parameters.name: nZone
parameters.businessMeaning: Aligns the geometric position of the board to a specific wall layer (Negative = Outside, Positive = Inside).
parameters.affectsOutput: Determines the Z-position (depth) of the board relative to the wall coordinate system.

parameters.name: dOffset
parameters.businessMeaning: Fine adjustment to shift the board from the defined alignment zone.
parameters.affectsOutput: Shifts the board closer or further from the wall face.

parameters.name: sSheetLR
parameters.businessMeaning: Selects which vertical sides (Left/Right) receive boards.
parameters.affectsOutput: Enables/disables generation of left and right side sheets.

parameters.name: sSheetTB
parameters.businessMeaning: Selects which horizontal sides (Top/Bottom) receive boards.
parameters.affectsOutput: Enables/disables generation of header (top) and sill (bottom) sheets.

parameters.name: sReference
parameters.businessMeaning: Defines the anchor boundary. 'Construction' uses surrounding studs/trimmers to determine length. 'Opening' uses the raw opening size.
parameters.affectsOutput: Changes the calculation logic for determining the board start and end points.

parameters.name: sIgnoreParallelBeams
parameters.businessMeaning: When using 'Construction' reference, toggles whether to ignore beams running parallel to the packer (e.g., cripple studs) when finding boundaries.
parameters.affectsOutput: Alters which structural beams are used to clip the length of the packer.

parameters.name: sDelete
parameters.businessMeaning: Workflow control. Determines if the script instance remains in the model for later editing or is removed after geometry creation.
parameters.affectsOutput: If Yes, the TSL instance is erased; if No, it remains parametrically editable.

parameterDependencies.effect: Enables the logic for sIgnoreParallelBeams to filter boundary beams.
Swaps the geometric application of Width vs Height in some calculations relative to the wall plane.

outputEntities.description: Rectangular timber boards (plywood/OSB/solid timber) placed to line the opening or cover the aperture.
outputEntities.appliedTo: Parent Element (Wall) containing the selected Opening.

workflowDiagram: Script launched via command or catalog.
Check if on Insert cycle (>1). If so, erase instance and exit.
Check Execute Key (_kExecuteKey). If provided, load properties from catalog; else, show Dialog to set properties.
Prompt user to select Opening(s).
Iterate through selected Openings.
For each Opening, retrieve the parent Element.
Verify parent Element exists. If not, erase instance for that Opening and continue.
Extract numeric properties (Width, Height, Gaps) from string inputs, defaulting missing values.
Determine Reference Zone alignment logic (calculate nSign and ptZRef based on nZone).
Identify surrounding beams (Construction) or use Opening dimensions to calculate packer start/end points (ptsPackers).
Filter out parallel beams if 'Ignore parallel beams' is Yes and Reference is Construction.
Calculate the geometric length of packers based on found points.
Iterate through 4 sides (Top, Bottom, Left, Right).
Skip sides not enabled by 'Create vertical/horizontal sheet' properties.
Apply gaps (Gap at ends, Gap to opening).
Check if calculated length is valid (>Epsilon). If too small, report error and skip this side.
Create Sheet entity at calculated position and orientation.
Apply Sheet properties (Color, Name, Material, etc.) and assign to Element Zone.
Assign created Sheets to the Output Map (_Map).
Check 'Delete TSL after insertion'. If Yes, erase instance. If No, keep instance for editing.

path1.name: Silent/Catalog Load
steps: Load properties from specific catalog entry.

path1.name: Construction Reference
steps: Use filterBeamsHalfLineIntersectSort to find closest beams.
Use beam centerlines to define packer start/end points.
Apply 'Ignore parallel beams' filter if active.

path2.name: Opening Reference
steps: Use Opening geometry (width/height) to define packer boundaries.

path1.name: Packer
steps: Align width towards the Zone reference.
Orient sheet vertically inside the reveal (90 deg rotation logic applied).

path2.name: Covering board
steps: Align thickness towards the Zone reference.
Standard orientation relative to wall face.

path1.name: Negative Zones (Outside)
steps: Adjust alignment point ptZRef towards outside (-vecZ).

path2.name: Positive Zones (Inside)
steps: Adjust alignment point ptZRef towards inside (+vecZ).
Special handling for Zone 6 (uses previous zone height).

validationRules.errorMessage: Script implicitly checks if Element is valid. If Element() is invalid, it erases instance.
validationRules.recovery: Ensure the Opening is part of a valid Element/Wall construction.

validationRules.errorMessage: could not find beams around opening.
validationRules.recovery: Ensure the opening has trimmers/cripple studs. Change 'Reference' to 'Opening' or reduce 'Ignore parallel beams' setting.

validationRules.errorMessage: Opening is to small or gap is to big
validationRules.recovery: Reduce 'Gap at ends' or 'Gap to opening' values. Ensure the opening is physically large enough for the packer.

postInsertionActions.effect: Changing properties like Width, Height, Gaps, or Zones triggers a recalculation of the Sheet geometry and position.
Toggles the generation of Left/Right or Top/Bottom sheets dynamically.

postInsertionActions.how: OPM Property 'Delete TSL after insertion' set to Yes
postInsertionActions.effect: Removes the parametric TSL instance, leaving only the generated Sheets as static geometry.

data.markdown:
# hsb_OpeningPackers

## Overview
This script automatically generates timber sheeting (packers/reveal liners or covering boards) around wall openings based on defined wall layers and zones. It is typically used to create structural backing for drywall (Packers) or aesthetic external timber returns (Covering boards).

## Usage Environment
| Space | Supported | Notes |
|-------|-----------|-------|
| Model Space | Yes | The script must be run in the model where the wall elements and openings exist. |
| Paper Space | No | Not intended for layout views. |
| Shop Drawing | No | Generates physical sheet entities (3D model), not drawing annotations. |

## Prerequisites
- **Required Entities**: An existing Wall Element containing at least one Opening.
- **Minimum Beam Count**: The wall construction must have beams surrounding the opening if using "Construction" reference.
- **Required Settings**: None specific, though a catalog entry is recommended for saving presets.

## Usage Steps

### Step 1: Launch Script
Command: `TSLINSERT` (or catalog selection)
Action: Select `hsb_OpeningPackers.mcr` from the file dialog or click the catalog button.

### Step 2: Select Opening(s)
```
Command Line: Select opening(s)
Action: Click on the opening(s) in the drawing where you want to generate packers or covering boards. Press Enter to confirm selection.
```

### Step 3: Configuration (Optional)
Action: If no specific execute key was used, a properties dialog may appear automatically. Alternatively, select the inserted TSL instance and open the **Properties Palette (OPM)** to adjust settings before the script executes/finishes.

## Properties Panel Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| **Sheet Definition** | | | |
| Insert as | Dropdown | Packer | Defines the position of the boards. "Packer" places them inside the reveal; "Covering board" covers the opening from the outside. |
| Width | Text | 100 | Defines the width of the board (mm). Use one value for all sides, or a sequence (e.g., `top;bottom;right;left`) for independent widths. |
| Thickness | Text | 20 | Defines the thickness of the board (mm). Use one value for all sides, or a sequence (e.g., `top;bottom;right;left`) for independent thicknesses. |
| Gap at the ends | Text | Empty | Clearance margin at the ends of the sheet (mm). Use one value or a sequence (top;bottom;right;left). |
| Gap to opening | Text | Empty | Clearance margin relative to the opening frame (mm). Use one value or a sequence. |
| Sheet properties | Text | Empty | Sets entity properties. Format: `ColourIndex; Name; Material; Grade; Information; Label; SubLabel; Beamcode`. |
| Assign to zone | Dropdown | 0 | Logical zone to assign the generated sheets to (-5 to 5). |
| **Sheet Position** | | | |
| Zone to align sheet to | Dropdown | 0 | Physical zone to align the sheet geometry to. Negative = Outside, Positive = Inside. |
| Offset to zone | Number | 0 | Fine-tunes the position away from the aligned zone (mm). |
| Create a vertical sheet(s) | Dropdown | None | Select to generate Left, Right, or Both vertical sides. |
| Create a horizontal sheet(s) | Dropdown | None | Select to generate Bottom, Top, or Both horizontal sides. |
| Reference | Dropdown | Construction | "Construction" uses surrounding beams to calculate length; "Opening" uses the raw opening size. |
| Ignore parallel beams | Dropdown | No | If "Reference" is Construction, ignores beams running parallel to the packer (e.g., cripple studs). |
| **Behavior of Tsl instance** | | | |
| Delete TSL after insertion | Dropdown | Yes | If "Yes", the script instance is removed after creating geometry. If "No", it remains for editing. |

## Right-Click Menu Options
This script does not add specific custom items to the right-click context menu.

## Settings Files
- **Filename**: None
- **Location**: N/A
- **Purpose**: N/A (Configuration is handled via OPM properties).

## Tips
- **Individual Sizing**: You can specify different dimensions for each side of the opening using semicolons. For example, in the **Width** field, enter `100;100;50;50` to set Top/Bottom to 100mm and Left/Right to 50mm.
- **Zone Alignment**: Use negative numbers for the **Zone to align sheet to** to position packers on the exterior side of the wall, and positive numbers for the interior side.
- **Reference Mode**: If your packers are coming out too short or too long, switch **Reference** from "Construction" to "Opening" (or vice versa) to change whether the script calculates length based on the studs or the window frame itself.
- **Static vs. Parametric**: If you plan to modify the wall or window frequently, set **Delete TSL after insertion** to "No". This allows you to select the TSL later and update the packers without re-inserting the script.

## FAQ
- **Q: Why did the script not generate boards on one side?**
  - A: Check the **Create a vertical sheet(s)** and **Create a horizontal sheet(s)** properties. You may have "None" or "Left/Right" selected when you need "Top/Bottom".
- **Q: What does the error "Opening is too small or gap is too big" mean?**
  - A: The calculated length of the board is effectively zero or negative. Reduce the values in **Gap at the ends** or **Gap to opening**.
- **Q: How do I assign the packers to a specific material layer?**
  - A: Use the **Assign to zone** property to match a layer defined in your wall construction, or manually set the material in the **Sheet properties** string.
